comments.body: Is it true also for Windows?

> Is it true also for Windows?

Have no idea about Windows. 
Before on Linux it was enough just link library and copy some files in binary directory,
but now with recent CEF one have to copy much more files to `$ROOTSYS/lib` subdirectory - otherwise CEF crashing at very beginning. I will continue investigation - for the moment it is the only way I found

I for first time manage to compile CEF on my machine from sources and now want to test some new CEF feature with non-X11 backend - maybe one could really use CEF also with headless mode directly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +50,54 @@

## copy different CEF files into library directory to avoid CEF_ROOT shell variable when running ROOT

file(GLOB cef_bins ${CEF_BLOBS}/*.bin)
